0.text: Bug 13725  Revert is much slower than close and re-open in java editor..

1.text: 1) Start by opening an editor on the file  org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder "Eclipse SWT  Custom Widgets" in the project "org.eclipse.swt" in the open source repository.

2.text: 2) Now, select the end of the first line, and hit a space character so that  the file has been marked dirty.

3.text: From this point, on my (fast) machine at home, it takes about 8 seconds to  perform the following steps:   - click on the close box in the editor tab.

4.text: - answer "no" to the "do you want to save changes" dialog   - double click on the file in the navigator to re-open it.

5.text: However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select "Revert" from the pop up  menu in the editor it takes > 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window  with the original.

6.text: This seems odd, since reverting the file contents ought not  to be more than closing and re-opening the file.
